oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Omah Kear making brooms at Gatlinburg, Sevier County, Tennessee
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Man standing under a large outdoor tent making brooms. Broom-making materials can be seen around him and a pulley system is pictured at left. At left rear is a large black pot with a wooden spit for cooking.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Handicraft; Brooms & brushes; Tents; Pulleys; Cooking utensils; Men
